brief_summary.textblock:
This trial is a prospective, single center, unblinded, randomized, controlled study to
      assess the safety and efficacy of negative pressure wound therapy in preventing infections
      after TKA surgery . The study will enroll 316 patients that will undergo TKA. patients will
      be randomized to the treatment group and undergo the study intervention - (NPWT) The
      intervention will take place at the end of the surgery. The  Patients that are randomized to
      the control group will receive standard treatment. Both groups will be assessed at  two
      weeks and six weeks. period.

clinical_study.brief_title: Negative Pressure Wound Therapy -PREVENA in Prevention of Infections After Total Knee Arthroplasty (TKA)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Ages: 18 to 80

          -  Males- not involved in active military duty.

          -  Females-non child bearing potential, or females of child-bearing potential who have a
             negative pregnancy test (hCG urine) within 72 hours of informed consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Active systemic or local infection.

          -  History of malignancy, radiotherapy, or chemotherapy for malignancy (except BCC of
             the skin)

          -  Active autoimmune disease.

          -  Any past or present immunosuppressive treatment.

          -  Current treatment with chemotherapeutic agents

          -  History of metabolic bone disease (primary or secondary).

          -  Chronic renal insufficiency (defined by 50% increase of normal levels).

intervention.description: administration of antibiotics before the first incision, keeping the surgery field sterile and performing several rinsing

primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint of the study is to evaluate the proportion of infections at the  treatment and control groups after six weeks
primary_outcome.measure: The primary endpoint of the study is to evaluate the proportion of infections at the  treatment and control groups after six weeks

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: To assess the proportion on infections at two  weeks and 6 weeks of follow-up.
secondary_outcome.measure: 1. To assess the proportion on infections at two  weeks and 6 weeks of follow-up.

secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients recommended to undergo further procedural intervention because of the infection.
secondary_outcome.measure: The number of patients recommended to undergo further procedural intervention because of the infection.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
